summary: Equipping a torch scares off certain predators.
descriptionHtml:
[b][u][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=5]Description[/size][/font][/u][/b]
[size=3]Equipping a torch protects you from certain beasts. They won't attack you on sight anymore, but they'll stalk you until your torch runs out, or they find an easier target. Getting too close with your torch will cause them to flee. See the screenshots for a visual representation. New features in Dynamic Mode allow beasts to advance slowly on you and attack during the day. During the night and in dark environments, beasts become more cautious of your torch and flee as you get close.[/size]

[size=3]The effected creatures are:[/size]
[list][*][size=3]Wolves[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Bears[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Sabre Cats[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Skeevers[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Small Frostbite Spiders[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Ice Wraiths[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Trolls[/size][/*]
[/list]
[size=3]Here are some videos which explain the mod and show you the effects:[/size]

[b]       Version 1.4 Video by Brodual                                                                       [b][size=2]Version 1.3 Video by ThyWorm[/size][/b]
[/b]      [youtube]aS0Ef3mbVoQ[/youtube]        [youtube]6PQqlhNbbI8[/youtube]

       [b]Version 1.0 Video by MCDofficial[/b]
      [youtube]6nIG4LBx824[/youtube]

[size=3]After installing version 1.1 or higher, your player will automatically be given the ability Primal Fear. You'll see a notification in the top left saying "You are empowered with Primal Fear". If you wish to toggle the spell on yourself or another NPC, you can use one of the two spells I've made. They are added through the console so you don't have to clutter up your spell tabs. Flames of Primal Fear is used to toggle the effects for yourself. Fireball of Primal Fear is used to toggle the effects on NPCs. It can be cast on all playable races, and should support followers made from a custom race. Using the fireball on your followers and giving them a torch will allow them to scare off beasts at night.[/size]

[b][u][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=5]Getting The Spells (not required)[/size][/font][/u][/b]
[size=3]The spells are only required if you want to toggle off the effects for yourself, or if you want to add the ability to your follower. Open the console with ~ and type help "of Primal Fear" (the quotation marks are necessary). You should see the IDs for the two spells. Type into the console player.addspell along with the spells ID and press enter. A notification will pop up in the top-left letting you know that the spell was added.

The spells are found in the Illusion Tab, and are cast like any other spell. Additionally, you'll see notifications in the top-left telling you if you enabled or disabled the ability.[/size]

[b][u][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=5]Installation[/size][/font][/u][/b]
[size=3]Install with NMM. Only use one of the 1.5 files, either Dynamic or Default.
Or
Download manually, unzip the contents, open the primal fear folder and copy-paste the data folder into your skyrim directory. Yes to all merges.

[/size][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=5][u][b]Uninstallation[/b][/u][/size][/font]
[size=3]Uninstall with NMM
Or
Deleting PrimalFear.esp in your Data folder will stop most of the scripts and remove the spells and abilities.

There is one script left on your save file after uninstalling. It does absolutely nothing in-game but it does add about 0.06 kb of data onto your save file. If you want to remove this use [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52363/?]Save game script cleaner[/url]. This tool is also great for removing scripts left by other mods you've uninstalled. It greatly improved stability for me.
[/size] [size=3]
[/size][b][u][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=5]Recommended Mods[/size][/font][/u][/b]
[size=3]This mod is based off of the fire cloak spell. Because of this, NPCs will comment very frequently about you using spells. To stop them from making these comments, install this mod:[/size]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57302/][size=3]Dangerous Spell Comments Removed[/size][/url][size=3] - by Matthiaswagg[/size]

[size=3]There is a Brawl Bug where your opponent will think you are casting a spell and begin to fight you to the death. To remove this bug use this mod:[/size]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24020/][size=3]Brawl Bugs Patch[/size][/url][size=3] - by jonwd7[/size]

[size=3]I'd also recommend making animals, especially wolves, harder to encourage you to make use of this new ability. Here are a couple mods which you can try:[/size]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/21332/][size=3]Dangerous Wolves[/size][/url][size=3] - by jimmybob[/size]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/44576/][size=3]Lore-mongering Beasts[/size][/url][size=3] - by Rennn[/size]

[font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=5][b][u]Compatibility[/u][/b][/size][/font]
[size=3]This mod doesn't change animals at all, it just adds cloak spells to the player which have effects on certain creatures. Because of this, it will never break your game if you're using it with creature mods. But, to have the fear work correctly on a creature, it has to have a defined race (eg. WolfRace). Most mod authors already do this, so you shouldn't have to worry about compatibility.

Here are some mods which I've checked to be compatible:
[list][*][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/35631/?]Monster Mod[/url][/size][/*]
[*][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24913/?]Skyrim Immersive Creatures[/url][/size][/*]
[*][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57413/?]Animallica[/url] (Only the new wolves, bears and sabre cats)[/size][/*]
[/list][/size]
[size=3]More will be added as I check them.
[/size]
[b][u][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=5]Credits[/size][/font][/u][/b]
[size=3]andresvk - for requesting the mod on Skyrim Mods Reddit & play-testing help
Matthiaswagg & egocarib - for their invaluable help on the scripts
allzero - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/21852/]Toggle-ableSpells Tutorial
[/url][/size][font=Trebuchet MS][size=3]Verteiron - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/38382/?]Animation Catcher[/url] used in finding shout animation for 1.5[/size][/font]
author: DServant

files.name: Primal Fear 1.1
files.changelogHtml: Attached a script to the torch which adds the ability to the player if you're in a area with a torch

files.name: Primal Fear 1.2
files.changelogHtml: Removed the script on the torch, rewrote it, and added it into an automatic hidden quest

files.name: Primal Fear 1.3
files.changelogHtml: All the problems with other cloak spells have been fixed

files.name: Primal Fear 1.4 Default
files.changelogHtml:
Beasts will fight if provoked (hp below 80%), no more wailing on them in a corner

Removed "Primal Fear Added" messages when you start the mod and every ten minutes (on update). You'll only see "You are empowered with Primal Fear" when you start the game.

Bug Fixes (ability wasn't updating on NPCs correctly)

All script names start with "DSer" now, for clarity

Two Modes:
Dynamic - Beasts fear will depend on time of day and light level. At night and in low light, they will stalk from theshadows and flee if you get too close. During the day, beasts will be cautious and advance on you slowly. If theyget close enough, they'll begin to move faster and attack. Use the slow to get away before they reach you.
Default - Beasts will fear your torch and stalk you at all times.

files.name: Primal Fear 1.4 Dynamic
files.changelogHtml:
Beasts will fight if provoked (hp below 80%), no more wailing on them in a corner

Removed "Primal Fear Added" messages when you start the mod and every ten minutes (on update). You'll only see "You are empowered with Primal Fear" when you start the game.

Bug Fixes (ability wasn't updating on NPCs correctly)

All script names start with "DSer" now, for clarity

Two Modes:
Dynamic - Beasts fear will depend on time of day and light level. At night and in low light, they will stalk from theshadows and flee if you get too close. During the day, beasts will be cautious and advance on you slowly. If theyget close enough, they'll begin to move faster and attack. Use the slow to get away before they reach you.
Default - Beasts will fear your torch and stalk you at all times.

files.name: Primal Fear 1.5 Dynamic
files.changelogHtml:
Fire Breath fears enemies in a radius around the player, no hit required

Equipping the Fire Storm spell has the same effect as equipping a torch

Mod Cleaning

files.name: Primal Fear 1.5 Default
files.changelogHtml:
Fire Breath fears enemies in a radius around the player, no hit required

Equipping the Fire Storm spell has the same effect as equipping a torch

Mod Cleaning
